comments:
I20041208-gtk

(also see screenshot I will attach)
While synchronizing, I already started looking at incoming changes. At some
point, while opening the compare viewer (upper progress dialog on screenshot),
an error occurred in CVS (see trace below), which caused the progress view to
pop up an error dialog (lower dialog on screenshot) telling me about the failure.

While the UI seems live (redraws do occur), no events get through to the
dialogs, I cannot push a button using the mouse or keyboard. Eclipse is dead. I
suppose it has something to do with double modal context threads or so.

--------- CVS error ----------

Created an attachment (id=16512)
screenshot.png

Screenshot showing eclipse locked up. The upper dialog is the progress dialog
from opening a compare viewer on an incoming change. The lower dialog is an
error dialog telling me about an exception in a job.

Upping the priority.  If eclipse is dead, presumably you can't exit properly. 
This could result in a loss of data.
confirmed. I had to kill eclipse to exit.

You can see this (without getting locked out) by doing the following in the 
jobs example

1) Change the fail case to fail halfway
2) Start a 10 second failing job 
3) Start a user job

The error dialog will come to the front but if you click on it you will go 
back to the user dialog. In this case you can still close them but you can see 
the issue.

The solution is to block opening on errors while there is a modal dialog open 
in the same that user jobs do (released for build >20041210).

Would I would like to do is to replicate this for the testing pass next week. 
Tom can you describe the compare operation in more detail? I want to get a 
dialog like you did first.

Hm, I guess I did the following:

- in the synchronize view, double click on an incoming change; alternatively,
choose 'Show in Compare Viewer' from the context menu.
> a progress dialog comes up while Team/CVS fetches the remote version.
- Click cancel in this dialog. 
> The dialog's controls are disabled while the fetch job is aborting
(presumeably while the cvs connection is closed or so). This can take a couple
of seconds with my machine / connection speed.

That's it - I guess I was really lucky to get a (unrelated?) job error right there.
*** Bug 81683 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
